response:
A young male presenting with acute, multifocal CNS signs (optic nerve and cerebellum) strongly suggests an inflammatory demyelinating pathology. Multiple Sclerosis is the most common cause. The concurrent finding of airspace disease on CXR raises the possibility of Acute Disseminated Encephalomyelitis (ADEM) secondary to infection, or an infection-triggered MS relapse. NMO and MOGAD are important differentials for severe optic neuritis.
